00065 // Returns true if the string str1 is equal to str2. case sensitive.
00066 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_strEqualCS(const char *str1,const char *str2);
00067 // Returns true if the forst len characters of string str1 are equal to str2.
00068 // case sensitive.
00069 // Note that if str1 or str2 are shorter than len characters then are considered as NOT equal!
00070 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_strEqualCSN(const char *str1,const char *str2,int len);
00071 // no such tricks in non-asm
00072 #define kvi_strEqualNoLocaleCI(str1,str2) kvi_strEqualCI(str1,str2)
00073 #define kvi_strEqualNoLocaleCIN(str1,str2,len) kvi_strEqualCIN(str1,str2,len)
00074 #define kvi_strLen(str) strlen(str)
00075 
00076 // Returns true if the string str1 is equal to str2.
00077 // case insensitive.
00078 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_strEqualCI(const char *str1,const char *str2);
00079 // Returns true if the forst len characters of string str1 are equal to str2.
00080 // case insensitive.
00081 // Note that if str1 or str2 are shorter than len characters then are considered as NOT equal!
00082 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_strEqualCIN(const char *str1,const char *str2,int len);

00084 // Once I wrote it, I KNOW what they do : ALWAYS :)
00085 // Note that greater here means that comes AFTER in the alphabetic order.

00097 
00098 //=============================================================================
00099 //
00100 // A simple string class.<br>
00101 // -No data sharing.<br>
00102 // -Not UNICODE.<br>
00103 // -Has ALWAYS NON-NULL DATA.<br>
00104 // -(Maybe)Unsafe :)<br>
00105 // WARNING : Handle with care and use at own risk :)<br>
00106 //
00107 //=============================================================================
00108 
00109 class KVILIB_API KviCString : public KviHeapObject
00110 {
00111 public:
00112         // No particular reason for these two names...
00113         // It is just because I like it :)
00114 
00115         enum KviFormatConstructorTag { Format, Sprintf };
00116 
00117         //=============================================================================
00118         // Constructors
00119         //=============================================================================
00120 
00121         // Empty string == "", len = 0, 1 byte allocated
00122         KviCString();
00123 
00124         // Deep copy of the NULL TERMINATED string (NULL str SAFE)
00125         KviCString(const char *str);
00126 
00127         // Copy len characters from string str (NOT NULL str SAFE, str MUST be at least len chars long)
00128         KviCString(const char *str,int len);
00129 
00130         // bg and end are pointers to a SINGLE string.<br>
00131         // A string is extracted starting from bg and ending at end (not included).<br>
00132         KviCString(const char *bg,const char *end);
00133 
00134         // Format constructor.<br>
00135         // tag is....yes....a dummy number used to resolve ambiguities.<br>
00136         // It is SAFE: will fail only if we run out of memory,<br>
00137         // but can handle only %s %d %u and %c.
00138         KviCString(KviFormatConstructorTag tag,const char *fmt,...);
00139 
00140         // Carbon copy :)...fast
00141         KviCString(const KviCString &str);
00142 
00143         // Compat with QT...<br>
00144         // WARNING : With QT2.x it WILL loose UNICODE data.<br>
00145         // Safe even if the QString is null.
00146         KviCString(const QString &str);
00147 
00148         KviCString(const QByteArray &str);
00149 
00150         // Fill sonstructor.
00151         // Creates a string long fillLen characters filled with character c.<br>
00152         KviCString(char c,int fillLen = 1);
00153 
00154         KviCString(const kvi_wchar_t * unicode);
00155 
00156         KviCString(const kvi_wchar_t * unicode,int len);
00157 
00158         // just free(m_ptr)
00159         ~KviCString();
00160 public:
00161         //yes...public..but think it as private...:)
00162         char *m_ptr; // pointer to allocated buffer, do not change this!
00163         int   m_len; // string data length not including the terminator
00164 
00165 public:
00166         //=============================================================================
00167         // Basic const interface (read stuff)
00168         //=============================================================================
00169 
00170         // Internal data buffer
00171         char * ptr() const              { return m_ptr; };
00172         // Length: fast, cached
00173         int len() const                 { return m_len; };
00174 
00175         // I hate this operator...but sometimes it is really useful
00176         // especially in macros (KviOptions.cpp)
00177         operator const char * () const  { return m_ptr; };
00178 
00179         bool isEmpty() const            { return (m_len == 0); };
00180         bool hasData() const            { return (m_len != 0); };
00181 
00182         // this is better than string = "", it does not call strlen
00183         void clear();
00184 
00185         // Returns true if there is something "readable" inside the string
00186         bool hasNonWhiteSpaceData() const;
00187 
00188         // Character at zero-based index : always safe!
00189         char & at(int idx) const        { return ((idx < m_len) ? m_ptr[idx] : m_ptr[m_len]);        };
00190 
00191         // character checks
00192         bool lastCharIs(char ch)  const { return (m_len > 0) ? (*(m_ptr + m_len - 1) == ch) : false; };
00193         bool firstCharIs(char ch) const { return (*m_ptr == ch);                                     };
00194 
00195         // upper and lower case copies
00196         KviCString upper() const;
00197         KviCString lower() const;
00198         KviCString upperISO88591() const;
00199         KviCString lowerISO88591() const;
00200 
00201         // left, right & co.
00202         // all parameters are safety-checked
00203         KviCString left(int maxLen) const;
00204         KviCString right(int maxLen) const ;
00205         KviCString middle(int idx,int maxLen) const;
00206 
00207         KviCString leftToFirst(char c,bool bIncluded = false) const;
00208         KviCString leftToLast(char c,bool bIncluded = false) const;
00209 //      KviCString leftToFirst(const char * str); const;
00210 
00211         //=============================================================================
00212         // Non-const interface (write stuff)
00213         //=============================================================================
00214 
00215         // Null terminator is NOT included in len
00216         KviCString & setLen(int len);
00217 
00218         // str must not be 0, but len can be anything (it is checked)
00219         KviCString & setStr(const char *str,int len = -1);
00220         // Like the special constructor that gets the same args.
00221         void extractFromString(const char *begin,const char *end);
00222 
00223         // Safe sprintf. This one will never write past the end of the string
00224         // It can handle only %s %d %u and %c format flags.
00225         KviCString & sprintf(const char *fmt,...);
00226         
00227         KviCString & vsprintf(const char *fmt,kvi_va_list list);
00228 
00229         // append functions
00230         void append(const KviCString &str);
00231         void append(const QString &str);
00232         void append(char c);
00233         void append(const char *str);                                     // str CAN be 0
00234         void append(const char *str,int len);                             // str CAN NOT be 0, and MUST be at least len chars long
00235         void append(KviFormatConstructorTag dummy,const char *fmt,...);
00236 
00237         // prepend stuff, same as above
00238         void prepend(const KviCString &str);
00239         void prepend(const char *str);                                    // str CAN be 0
00240         void prepend(const char *str,int len);                            // str CAN NOT be 0, and MUST be at least len chars long
00241 
00242         // if lastCharIs ch does nothing otherwise appends it
00243         void ensureLastCharIs(char ch)              { if(!lastCharIs(ch))append(ch);        };
00244 
00245         // Change THIS string to uppercase or lowercase
00246         void toUpperISO88591();
00247         void toUpper(); // this is LOCALE AWARE (in Turkish it maps i to √ù!)
00248         void toLowerISO88591();
00249         void toLower();
00250 
00251         // Assignment
00252         KviCString & operator=(const KviCString &str);       // deep copy
00253         KviCString & operator=(const char *str);         // str can be NULL here
00254         KviCString & operator=(char c);                  // 2 bytes allocated,m_len = 1
00255         KviCString & operator=(const QString &str);
00256         KviCString & operator=(const QByteArray &str);
00257 
00258         // Append operators
00259         KviCString & operator+=(const KviCString &str)      { append(str); return (*this);          };
00260         KviCString & operator+=(const char *str)        { append(str); return (*this);          };
00261         KviCString & operator+=(char c)                 { append(c);   return (*this);          };
00262         KviCString & operator+=(const QString &str)     { append(str); return (*this);          };
00263 
00264         // Comparison
00265         bool equalsCI(const KviCString &other) const { if(m_len != other.m_len)return false; return kvi_strEqualCI(m_ptr,other.m_ptr); };
00266         bool equalsCS(const KviCString &other) const { if(m_len != other.m_len)return false; return kvi_strEqualCS(m_ptr,other.m_ptr); };
00267         bool equalsCI(const char * other) const { return kvi_strEqualCI(m_ptr,other); };
00268         bool equalsCS(const char * other) const { return kvi_strEqualCS(m_ptr,other); };
00269         bool equalsCIN(const char * other,int len) const { return kvi_strEqualCIN(m_ptr,other,len); };
00270         bool equalsCSN(const char * other,int len) const { return kvi_strEqualCSN(m_ptr,other,len); };
00271 
00272         //=============================================================================
00273         // HEX and Base64 stuff
00274         //=============================================================================
00275 
00276         // HEX transforms functions
00277         void bufferToHex(const char *buffer,int len);
00278         // Allocates the needed buffer and returns the allocated length,
00279         // returns -1 in case of error (and allocates nothing)
00280         // The string MUST contain only hex digits, and the digits MUST be in couples. (len % 2) must equal 0!
00281         // So this will fail also if there are leading or trailing spaces!
00282         int hexToBuffer(char ** buffer,bool bNullToNewlines = false);
00283         // BASE64 stuff
00284         void bufferToBase64(const char * buffer,int len);
00285         // same as hexToBuffer but obviously transforms base64 notation to binary data (len % 4) must equal 0!
00286         int base64ToBuffer(char ** buffer,bool bNullToNewlines = false);
00287 
00288         // frees a buffer allocated by hexToBuffer or base64ToBuffer
00289         static void freeBuffer(char * buffer);
00290 
00291         //=============================================================================
00292         // Splitters
00293         //=============================================================================
00294 
00295         // cut
00296         KviCString & cutLeft(int len);             // kills the first len characters
00297         KviCString & cutRight(int len);            // kills the last len characters
00298         KviCString & cut(int idx,int len);
00299         KviCString & cutToFirst(char c,bool bIncluded = true); // cuts the left part of the string up to the first character c or does nothing if the char c is not in the string
00300         KviCString & cutToLast(char c,bool bIncluded = true);
00301         KviCString & cutFromFirst(char c,bool bIncluded = true);
00302         KviCString & cutFromLast(char c,bool bIncluded = true);
00303         KviCString & cutToFirst(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true); // cuts the left part of the string up to the first character c or does nothing if the char c is not in the string
00304         KviCString & cutToLast(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true);
00305         KviCString & cutFromFirst(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true);
00306         KviCString & cutFromLast(const char *c,bool bIncluded = true);
00307         // & paste
00308         KviCString & insert(int idx,const char *data);
00309         KviCString & insert(int idx,char c);
00310         //Replaces all occurences of char c with the string str
00311         KviCString & replaceAll(const char c,const char *str);
00312         //same as above but with a string
00313         KviCString & replaceAll(const char *toFind,const char *str,bool bCaseS = true);
00314 
00315         KviCString & transliterate(const char * szToFind,const char * szReplacement);
00316 
00317         // Strips whitespace characters from beginning of this string.
00318         KviCString & stripLeftWhiteSpace();
00319         KviCString & stripRightWhiteSpace();
00320         // Stips inital and final WHITESPACE characters (see man isspace),<br>
00321         // and returns a reference to this string.
00322         KviCString & trim();
00323 
00324         // Strips spaces and tabs only
00325         KviCString & stripSpace();
00326         // Strips all occurences of the character c from the beginning of the string.<br>
00327         // Note that c can not be '\0' :)
00328         KviCString & stripLeft(char c);
00329         KviCString & stripRight(char c);
00330 
00331         // either "truncate to" or "add padding up" to iLen characters.
00332         KviCString & padRight(int iLen, const char c='\0');
00333         //=============================================================================
00334         // Tokenize
00335         //=============================================================================
00336 
00337         // Extracts (copy to str and remove) a token from this string,<br>
00338         // and returns true if there are more tokens to extract<br>
00339         // Does not strip initial separators!!<br>
00340         // str can NOT be this string.
00341         bool getToken(KviCString &str,char sep);
00342         // Does not strip initial separators!<br>
00343         // Can assign also to this string.
00344         KviCString getToken(char sep);
00345         // Extracts a line from the string.<br>
00346         // Returns false if there was no data to extract
00347         bool getLine(KviCString &str);
00348

00350         // separated by sep.
00351         KviCString ** splitToArray(char sep,int max,int * realCount) const;
00352         //KviCString ** splitToArray(const char * sep,int max,int * realCount) const;
00353         static void freeArray(KviCString ** strings);
00354         // joins the array to this string
00355         // if sep is not 0, it is inserted between the strings
00356         // if bLastSep is true and sep is non 0, then sep is also appended at the end
00357         // of the buffer (after the last string)
00358         void joinFromArray(KviCString ** strings,const char * sep = 0,bool bLastSep = false);

00380         // Overlapped matches are counted.

00469 
00470 // Cool string parsing function.
00471 // It will extract the first found token from the string aux_ptr, and return
00472 // a pointer to the beginning of the next token, or end of the string.
00473 // It skips the initial sep characters!
00474 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API const char * kvi_extractToken(KviCString &str,const char *aux_ptr,char sep =' ');
00475 // Does not skip the beginning separators!
00476 // Extracts data from the string up to the next separator character or the end of the string.
00477 // and returns a pointer to that separator (or string end).
00478 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API const char * kvi_extractUpTo(KviCString &str,const char *aux_ptr,char sep=' ');
00479 // Reduced vsnprintf...
00480 // Handles %s,%c,%d,%u  (%% are TWO percents here and not one.)
00481 // Returns -1 if the formatted string exceeded the buffer length.
00482 // Otherwise returns the length of the formatted buffer...(not including '\0')
00483 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API int kvi_vsnprintf(char *buffer,int len,const char *fmt,kvi_va_list list);
00484 // Reduced vsnprintf: special version for irc.
00485 // Handles %s,%c,%d,%u  (%% are TWO percents here and not one.)
00486 // Writes up to 510 characters and terminates the string with a CRLF
00487 // Sets bTruncated if the requested format string was too large to fit in 512 bytes
00488 // otherwise sets it to false; The buffer MUST be at least 512 bytes long.
00489 // Always returns the length of the formatted buffer...(max 512 - min 2=CRLF)
00490 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API int kvi_irc_vsnprintf(char *buffer,const char *fmt,kvi_va_list list,bool *bTruncated);
00491 
00492 // WILDCARD EXPRESSION MATCHING FUNCTIONS
00493 
00494 // Returns true if the two regular expressions with wildcards matches
00495 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchWildExpr(register const char *m1,register const char *m2);
00496 // Returns true if the two regular expressions with wildcards matches, case sensitive
00497 //__KVI_EXTERN bool kvi_matchWildExprCS(register const char *m1,register const char *m2); // actually unused
00498 // Same as kvi_matchWildExpr but with an additional char that acts as string terminator
00499 // If there is a match this function returns true and puts the pointers where it stopped in r1 and r2
00500 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchWildExprWithTerminator(register const char *m1,register const char *m2,char terminator,
00501                         const char ** r1,const char ** r2);
00502 
00503 // Returns true if the wildcard expression exp matches the string str
00504 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchStringCI(register const char * exp,register const char * str);
00505 #define kvi_matchString kvi_matchStringCI
00506 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchStringCS(register const char * exp,register const char * str);
00507 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API bool kvi_matchStringWithTerminator(register const char * exp,register const char * str,char terminator,const char ** r1,const char ** r2);
00508 
00509 // This function works like a particular case of strncmp.
00510 // It evaluates if str2 is the terminal part of str1.
00511 // example: if str1 is "this is an experiment" and str2 is "xperiment"
00512 // return 0.
00513 // With the index parameter, the match start on str1 from the specified
00514 // index. For example:
00515 // if str1 is "this is an experiment" and str2 is "an" we have return !0
00516 // but "this is an experiment"
00517 //      012345678901234567890
00518 // if we call kvi_strsubRevCS("this is an experiment","an", 9) we got a match.
00519 __KVI_EXTERN KVILIB_API int kvi_strMatchRevCS(const char *str1, const char *str2, int index=-1);
00520 
00521 // KviCString comparison non-member operators
00522 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator==(const KviCString &left,const KviCString &right)
00523 { return (left.m_len == right.m_len) ? kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right.m_ptr) : false; }
00524 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator==(const KviCString &left,const char *right)
00525 { return kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right); }
00526 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator==(const char *left,const KviCString &right)
00527 { return kvi_strEqualCS(left,right.m_ptr); }
00528 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator!=(const KviCString &left,const KviCString &right)
00529 { return !kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right.m_ptr); }
00530 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator!=(const KviCString &left,const char *right)
00531 { return !kvi_strEqualCS(left.m_ptr,right); }
00532 __KVI_EXTERN inline bool operator!=(const char *left,const KviCString &right)
00533 { return !kvi_strEqualCS(left,right.m_ptr); }
00534 
00535 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviCString operator+(const KviCString &left,const KviCString &right)
00536 { KviCString ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00537 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviCString operator+(const KviCString &left,const char *right)
00538 { KviCString ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00539 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviCString operator+(const char *left,const KviCString &right)
00540 { KviCString ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00541 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviCString operator+(const KviCString &left,char right)
00542 { KviCString ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00543 __KVI_EXTERN inline KviCString operator+(char left,const KviCString &right)
00544 { KviCString ret(left); ret += right; return ret; }
00545 
00546 inline int kvi_compare(const KviCString * p1,const KviCString * p2)
00547 {
00548         return kvi_strcmpCI(p1->ptr(),p2->ptr());
00549 }
